u-qke0zhFiU_f40wQca7Yw.text: I haven't even finished my meal here but I had to write. The soup (chicken pastina) looked like nothing special but was amazing . The broth was so flavorful, I suspect it had Parmesan rind in it to make it so good. Had the number three with aubergine and sundries tomato on ciabatta and it was just as lovely.

0zeMe3ppQBo8BxBqUZeTWg.text: Really cute small takeaway shop off the Royal Mile. Easily overlooked but shouldn't be! The sandwich prices are more than affordable and it's a very no-frills place to stop and grab a quick lunch. Note that dining in does cost an extra 20% tacked onto your bill. It's bar seating and first-come, first-served. Service is very friendly and quick!

HuIAJsw4dDdb7G6uHMXoXg.text: Easy to miss this teensy Italian takeaway (with some barstools for sitting in) despite its central location. I love little unprentious places like this that sell food that feels authentic, uses fresh, interesting ingredients and where there feels like a lot of choice. Imagine it's popular for lunch on the go but I was there early evening when the artichoke, olive and sundried tomato ciabatta and coffee were just what I needed waiting for the torchlight procession to start.

photos.caption: Photo of Italian on Mound - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Choice of almost 20 Italian style ciabattas etc and Scottish breakfast rolls.
